bibl.title: Letter from Albert E. Truby to Philip Showalter Hench, April 8, 1944

div1.p: Truby writes about his health. He encourages Hench to get James Carroll's personal papers from Carroll's son. He discusses a nurse who served with him in Cuba.

div1.head: Letter from Albert E. Truby to Philip Showalter Hench, April 8, 1944
div1.opener:
amened
Apr 22, 1944
Albert E. Truby
145 Laurel Street
San Francisco, California
Apr- 8/44
Dear Dr. Hench:-
div1.p:
I think that I should let you
know how I am progressing for
it was back in Jan that I wrote you
last. I continue to make nice progress
but as you know it is a slow affair,
for all of those muscles have to be
exercised and if you overdo them they
rebel- get sore- and that retards everything.
My right hand is getting to be quite
useful and I walk quite well- Do over
a mile a day by myself-

I do hope you will be able to get
on the right side of young Carroll and
get his notebooks, letters & other papers-
Perhaps they can be bought! The cover
I sent you may not be like the note
book we want to find. While I think it
may have been a book of that kind I
can not recollect anything about it,
especially as to its exact size or the color
of its cover. If I saw it and its contents
I would probably be able to identify it.
Keep after it, Very , important!

I failed to locate Lampon. By good luck
I found Vena Richmond, the nurse who
was in charge of the receiving ward, under
me, at Camp Columbia in 1899. She interviewed
Lampon when he was writing his book. You
will find her name among those he thanked
in his preface. She left us in Nov '99
for the P. I. so she could not be of help
to us about Reed's work. She has a fine
record of service in Cuba, P. I., Panama &
in the US. She was also with Noguchi in South
America. She liked my book-

I hope you have found a good
place to live and can have your family
with you, I also hope that you will
find things favorable for that special work
you had in mind.

Be sure to send me the photos of the
y. f. huts. Miss Richmond mentioned them
as their small pox huts while the 2d Div was there,
That confirms what we heard elsewhere.

Don't forget to keep me advised of
of your doings especially on the y. f.
work.
